metadata.synopsis: This dialogue covers instances where Gale attends the Withers party in a human (non-god) form. His default state is that he returned to Waterdeep and became a professor of Illusory magic at his former school, Blackstaff Academy. General vibe here is that this a Gale who's found peace with himself - he's a great teacher, one his students are mostly in awe of.If he's not a teacher in Waterdeep, he could be in several other states (living in Baldur's Gate, living in the hells, living in the underdark etc) but the general vibe is that he's always happy with where he's ended up, as in those cases he's there because that's where his romance partner chose to be.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: I know my charm is intoxicating, but let's not be poor company.

152.speaker: Gale
152.text: I know my charm is intoxicating, but let's not be poor company.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Go, have fun. I promise I'll stay out of trouble for one evening.

158.speaker: Gale
158.text: I can't believe this is real. I never thought we'd gather like this again.
158.context: NodeContext: Taking in the moment,  appreciating it

393.speaker: Gale
393.text: It's quite... ahem, yes really quite lovely.
393.context: NodeContext: Getting a bit choked up, trying to hide it/breeze past it

233.speaker: Gale
233.text: I must say, you're looking very well. I'd hazard a guess that  life without a tadpole in your skull is rather suiting you.
233.context: NodeContext: Still finds it all a bit too good to be true

380.speaker: Player
380.text: And it looks like life at Astarion's side is suiting you...
380.context: NodeContext: Still finds it all a bit too good to be true

6.speaker: Player
6.text: And it looks like life at Shadowheart's side is suiting you...
6.context: NodeContext: Still finds it all a bit too good to be true

327.speaker: Gale
327.text: It's strange to say it, but I've never been happier. This unexpected life of mine has turned out to be quite wonderful.
327.context: NodeContext: Still finds it all a bit too good to be true

266.speaker: Player
266.text: And it looks like life at Wyll's is suiting you...
266.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

450.speaker: Player
450.text: And it looks like life at Lae'zel's side is suiting you...
450.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

501.speaker: Player
501.text: And it looks like life at Karlach's side is suiting you...
501.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

141.speaker: Player
141.text: And it looks like wedded bliss is suiting you...
141.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

494.speaker: Player
494.text: And it looks like life at your lover's side is suiting you...
494.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

446.speaker: Player
446.text: It turns out I'm a lot happier without the omnipresent threat of death.
446.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: As am I. What a relief it was to set that particular burden down at last.
87.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

196.speaker: Gale
196.text: Of all the outcomes I might have expected from our journey, I confess - finding love wasn't one of them. But it so often lurks in the most unexpected of places.
196.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

545.speaker: Player
545.text: I confess, I've found life a little too quiet since our journey came to an end...
545.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I found the love of my life. I'd say I'm pretty happy.
128.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

344.speaker: Gale
344.text: You were quite the travelling companion, my friend. I know our paths diverge from here, but should you ever desire a wizard to walk at your side - you know where to find me.
344.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I might just take you up on that.
78.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Excellent. I'll have my sturdiest magical boots at the ready.

206.speaker: Player
206.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

458.speaker: Gale
458.text: It's good to see you again.
458.context: NodeContext: Warm, note of farewelll - could be his last line to the player

543.speaker: Player
543.text: Life as the Vampire Ascendant is busier than I expected. There's my lair to decorate, spawn to recruit, a domain to protect. I'm exhausted.

259.speaker: Player
259.text: I've settled back into the shadows. It turns out there's a lot more fun to be had there when you don't have a bitter, cruel vampire lord watching over you.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Oh, my life's much the same as before. Plotting Cazador's eventual, painful destruction...

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Lady Shar's church flourishes - but with it comes a great deal of work. I am kept busy, leading her ever-growing flock.

449.speaker: Player
449.text: I've been getting acquainted with the length and breadth of Faerûn - there's a lot to see, now that I'm free from Shar.

484.speaker: Player
484.text: I've got myself a quiet little cottage, a growing menagerie of animals, and my parents close at hand. I wouldn't trade it for anything.

490.speaker: Player
490.text: I've got myself a quiet little cottage, a growing menagerie of animals, and my parents close at hand. I wouldn't trade it for anything.

468.speaker: Player
468.text: I've been pursuing unfinished business. Defeating the Absolute came at the expense of my own concerns - now I have to rectify that.

428.speaker: Player
428.text: You know me. Neck deep in devil guts and demon blood until I find a permanent way out.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: I remain dedicated to the Coast. I will slay every last monster that threatens the people.

286.speaker: Player
286.text: My life as a Duke is one of bargains, diplomacy, and limited time to enjoy the successes.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: I've ripped the horns off so many cambions and pit fiends, I've lost count.

377.speaker: Player
377.text: When the innocent of the Coast are in danger, the Blade will always come calling.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm on the verge of a diplomatic breakthrough with the githzerai leader. Vlaakith's days are numbered.

549.speaker: Player
549.text: Vlaakith's forces hound me. And every last sarth among them has fallen to my blade.

328.speaker: Player
328.text: I've been practising meditation. Taking naps. I might train to be a massage therapist.

479.speaker: Player
479.text: I've found much to delight me in the Underdark. I think I'll be quite content there.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I've found much to delight me in the Underdark. I think I'll be quite content there.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I've grown accustomed to my new form. It offers certain... possibilities, so long as I can master it.

348.speaker: Player
348.text: Avernus is... interesting. We've been making a mess down there, that's for sure...

400.speaker: Player
400.text: I've been learning to see the world anew, without the tunnel vision my oath imposed. It's been... enlightening.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I can't complain. Though if I'm being entirely honest, I rather miss having the little squirmer along for the ride...
189.context: NodeContext: Genuine, appreciates the generosity of your sentiment

116.speaker: Gale
116.text: In that case, I'd highly recommend taking the time to expand your social horizons. You can do better than a worm for company, I promise you.

402.speaker: Player
402.text: I'm just happy to see you happy - even if it is with someone else.
402.context: NodeContext: Genuine, appreciates the generosity of your sentiment

420.speaker: Gale
420.text: And I'm glad you've found a love of your own. We both deserve that.
420.context: NodeContext: Genuine, appreciates the generosity of your sentiment

409.speaker: Gale
409.context: NodeContext: Genuine, appreciates the generosity of your sentiment

213.speaker: Gale
213.context: NodeContext: A little detached/wary - you're the lover who abandoned him. he's not sure what the vibe is yet

284.speaker: Gale
284.context: NodeContext: A little detached/wary - you're the lover who abandoned him. he's not sure what the vibe is yet

347.speaker: Gale
347.text: In a manner of speaking, I suppose. You are a little more transparent than I remember.
347.context: NodeContext: A little wary - he was nervous about this reunion with the ex who abandoned him (not angry, a little bit sad). Player is literally see through (a hologram)

390.speaker: Gale
390.text: It turns out rather a lot of my clothes are a bit bloodstained. Can't think why...
390.context: NodeContext: Light-hearted ribbing, isn't really bothered by this. Just wants reassurance.

260.speaker: Gale
260.text: You'd think I'd be used to dressing up, with all the pageantry life at your side has thrust upon me...
260.context: NodeContext: Light-hearted ribbing, isn't really bothered by this. Just wants reassurance.

356.speaker: Gale
356.text: Our adventures rarely lend themselves to luxury. Or cleanliness, for that matter. It's been some time since I've made such an effort...

337.speaker: Gale
337.text: Well! Sounds like you've been keeping yourself very busy indeed. It was never like you to lay about, so I shouldn't be surprised.

214.speaker: Gale
214.text: Well! Sounds like you've been keeping yourself very busy indeed. It was never like you to lay about, so I shouldn't be surprised.

167.speaker: Gale
167.text: Well! Sounds like you've been keeping yourself very busy indeed - and in good company, too. It was never like you to lay about, so I shouldn't be surprised.

210.speaker: Gale
210.text: I'm sorry to hear things have been so difficult. You have my sympathy, but not my pity. If anyone can do what needs doing, it's you.

268.speaker: Gale
268.text: I'm sorry to hear things have been so difficult. You have my sympathy, but not my pity. If anyone can do what needs doing, it's you - and your paramour.

412.speaker: Gale
412.text: You're quite certain I look acceptable?
412.context: NodeContext: A bit anxious at seeing everybody again, channeling it into anxiety about his clothes

395.speaker: Gale
395.text: I can't remember when I last wore something other than my teaching robes. It feels a little odd to find myself in something so unsinged.
395.context: NodeContext: A bit anxious at seeing everybody again, channeling it into anxiety about his clothes

199.speaker: Player
199.text: You look as wonderful to me as you did on our wedding day.
199.context: NodeContext: Relaxing, just needed some reassurance

230.speaker: Gale
230.text: That's a relief. I wasn't sure if I'd made too much of an effort. Or perhaps, not enough...
230.context: NodeContext: Relaxing, just needed some reassurance

163.speaker: Tara the Tressym
163.text: If only you'd applied those efforts to that thing on your chin...
163.context: NodeContext: Warm/light - he's just messing with her

279.speaker: Gale
279.text: The day I shave this beard, Tara, is that day I shave you. For both of our sakes, I hope it never comes.
279.context: NodeContext: Warm/light - he's just messing with her

418.speaker: Gale
418.text: I won't keep you to myself for too long, but while I have you - I want to say thank you for encouraging me to attend this evening.
418.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

336.speaker: Gale
336.text: Teaching at Blackstaff Academy has proven such an unexpected pleasure. Sometimes I find it hard to tear myself away.
336.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

242.speaker: Gale
242.text: Just one of the myriad unexpected ways life has delighted me in recent months.
242.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

507.speaker: Gale
507.text: Even my own city feels new to me, now that I share it with you.
507.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Probably because I make you put down your quill once in a while and enjoy it.
31.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: That you do. I've not had so much fun in Waterdeep since my own days as a wayward Blackstaff apprentice.

190.speaker: Gale
190.text: You've certainly made quite the impression on my friends down at the Yawning Portal. The last I heard, they were thinking of naming a drink after you.

365.speaker: Player
365.text: I've grown to love Waterdeep. Though I confess at first I found it a bit... overly pleased with itself.
365.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

263.speaker: Gale
263.text: An impression I'm delighted the city has managed to redeem. As have I, I hope.

478.speaker: Player
478.text: Thankfully Waterdeep has plenty of amusements on offer during the hours of darkness...
478.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

470.speaker: Player
470.text: I'm just glad Waterdeep is big enough to disappear into.
470.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

535.speaker: Gale
535.text: You've certainly exposed me to sides of Waterdeep I'd never had the pleasure of experiencing until now. If 'pleasure' is the word for such places...
535.context: NodeContext: On the second line, perhaps recalling a particularly dicey evening spent with Astarion in the more dangerous corners of Waterdeep

217.speaker: Player
217.text: After everything that happened with my parents, with Shar... it's been good to have a life of my own making, with you.
217.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

159.speaker: Player
159.text: The feeling's mutual. I have a new life, with you by my side, and my parents close at hand... it's more than I could have ever dreamed of.
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: As my mother always says, 'if you can't find yourself in Waterdeep, you're not looking in the right mirror.'
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: I'm just glad you're happy there. When we met, our lives were rather different, and being here this evening... well, it reminds me how much has changed.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

198.speaker: Gale
198.text: When Mystra quelled the orb at last, she did more than rid me of its threat. She created room for hope, where once I felt only despair.
198.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

172.speaker: Gale
172.text: When our adventure began, our troupe had no more in common than the worm in our brains.
172.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

511.speaker: Gale
511.text: Standing here now I no longer see the people we were - frightened, desperate, alone. We changed. We survived. And we did it together.
511.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

197.speaker: Gale
197.text: I've missed them. I've missed this.
197.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this', a gesture indicating to the wider camp/troupe - he's missed standing in a camp like this, with the gang for company

49.speaker: Player
49.text: So have I. Sometimes I wish our adventure never ended.
49.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: I wouldn't go quite that far. You made sacrifice enough to end it when we did - I dread to think what else might have come, had it gone on for longer.

493.speaker: Gale
493.text: As I told you long ago - it is to be avoided.

132.speaker: Gale
132.text: Gods knows, we suffered for our salvation, but it was worth it, wasn't it?

504.speaker: Gale
504.text: We did something incredible. And wherever life takes us - we'll carry the memory of that with us forever.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You know, you aren't tied to Avernus forever. You could come back any time.
73.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

229.speaker: Gale
229.text: Without you? Not a tressym in Hell's chance.
229.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

148.speaker: Tara the Tressym
148.text: Why, I do just fine in the Hells, Mr Dekarios. A bit of heat in these old bones is quite the luxury.
148.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

379.speaker: Gale
379.text: Quite right. And we're delighted every time the catflap of displacement brings you to us.
379.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

276.speaker: Gale
276.text: No, fear not - I've no burning desire to return to this plane. Strange as it is to say, I'm feeling rather at home in Avernus.
276.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

353.speaker: Gale
353.text: And with both Tara and I hard at work studying the finer points of devilish engineering, who knows - we might make a home in Waterdeep yet.
353.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

208.speaker: Gale
208.text: And so long as I continue my studies on the finer points of infernal engineering, who knows - we might make a home in Waterdeep yet.
208.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

451.speaker: Gale
451.text: Now, much as I could spend an eternity in your company - we see plenty of each other already.
451.context: NodeContext: Warmly drawing the conversation to a close

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: Tempting as it is to keep you all to myself, we'd be terrible company if we didn't mingle for at least part of the evening.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

506.speaker: Player
506.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

313.speaker: Gale
313.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

371.speaker: Gale
371.context: NodeContext: With the warmth of having said this a thousand times before

437.speaker: Gale
437.text: Now go on, before I change my mind.
437.context: NodeContext: Gentle joking - referring to him having previously told the player they'd be rude if they just hung out with each other all night

392.speaker: Gale
392.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

228.speaker: Gale
228.context: NodeContext: With the warmth of having said this a thousand times before

401.speaker: Gale
401.text: Now go on, before I change my mind.
401.context: NodeContext: Gentle joking - referring to him having previously told the player they'd be rude if they just hung out with each other all night

54.speaker: Gale
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

521.speaker: Gale
521.context: NodeContext: With the warmth of having said this a thousand times before

388.speaker: Gale
388.text: Now go on, before I change my mind.
388.context: NodeContext: Gentle joking - referring to him having previously told the player they'd be rude if they just hung out with each other all night

40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale kisses the player (generic anim)

293.speaker: Gale
293.context: NodeContext: With the warmth of having said this a thousand times before

326.speaker: Gale
326.text: Now go on, before I change my mind.
326.context: NodeContext: Gentle joking - referring to him having previously told the player they'd be rude if they just hung out with each other all night

554.speaker: Gale
554.text: Enjoy yourself, my love. I'll be right here if you need me. Or else somewhere near the buffet...

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I can't say I miss it. The blood, the fleas, the looming threat of death...
52.context: NodeContext: Referring to the equivalent of Black Friday sales

335.speaker: Gale
335.text: I'm surprised to hear you so squeamish given your, er, dietary predilections. I assume that's why you eat with your eyes closed.
335.context: NodeContext: Referring to the equivalent of Black Friday sales

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: I suggest we steer clear of the Trades Ward during Waukeentide, in that case.
100.context: NodeContext: Referring to the equivalent of Black Friday sales

161.speaker: Gale
161.text: The perils we faced are but trifles compared to those inflicted by the shoppers of Waterdeep when there's a bargain to be had.
161.context: NodeContext: Referring to the equivalent of Black Friday sales

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Miss this lot? No - I much prefer our lives now we've left all this behind.

134.speaker: Gale
134.text: We have had some fun, haven't we?

334.speaker: Gale
334.text: I suppose you're right. Our adventures had their time and place, but it's good that we've moved forward. Carved out a life for ourselves every bit as rich and rewarding as the journey that brought us together.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: We still have each other. That's all I'll ever need.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: I could never forget about you, Tara. You wouldn't let me.

346.speaker: Gale
346.text: I'm not sure I'll ever get over my good fortune in that respect. You are the happiness I never dreamed I could deserve.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You almost sound like you want to go adventuring again...
82.context: NodeContext: Cautiously revealing the existence of his memoirs.

292.speaker: Gale
292.text: No, no, I prefer the warmth of my library's hearth these days. But the feeling of adventure... I confess - that I long for.
292.context: NodeContext: Cautiously revealing the existence of his memoirs.

183.speaker: Tara the Tressym
183.text: Now, Mr Dekarios, we've spoken about this. You really must find safer pastimes - for your own good, and mine too.
183.context: NodeContext: Cautiously revealing the existence of his memoirs.

339.speaker: Gale
339.text: I have been dabbling with the idea of capturing our adventures with humble ink and parchment.
339.context: NodeContext: Cautiously revealing the existence of his memoirs.

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: We've tales enough to fill a good few volumes, and when the truth runs out, who knows... My quill might take us on further adventures yet.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: You almost sound like you want to go adventuring again...
243.context: NodeContext: Knows the palyer far too well to believe they aren't happy to be here

477.speaker: Player
477.text: Our friends have no equals. They liked me, even when I was Bhaal's monster.
477.context: NodeContext: Knows the palyer far too well to believe they aren't happy to be here

537.speaker: Gale
537.text: And I'm quite certain they're as delighted to see you as you are to see them.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I suppose life has been a little less interesting since we all went our separate ways..
47.context: NodeContext: Knows the palyer far too well to believe they aren't happy to be here

212.speaker: Gale
212.text: You feign indifference but I can see it in your eye. You're as delighted to be amongst this company as I am.
212.context: NodeContext: Knows the palyer far too well to believe they aren't happy to be here

454.speaker: Gale
454.text: Speaking of which, I think it's high time you blessed someone other than myself with your inimitable presence.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: It's strange to start a new life when I didn't truly confront my old one, but I'm glad I'm with you.
250.context: NodeContext: Loving, likes that Wyll is so protective of him

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I can serve the Coast from Waterdeep - and I can keep an eye on you while I'm at it.
147.context: NodeContext: Loving, likes that Wyll is so protective of him

248.speaker: Gale
248.text: Protective as ever, but fear not - my ambition now stretches only as far as getting my marking done in time for us to share a glass of zzar in the Yawning Portal.
248.context: NodeContext: Loving, likes that Wyll is so protective of him

364.speaker: Player
364.text: I miss Baldur's Gate - but I'm content to spend time in Waterdeep.

532.speaker: Player
532.text: I'm fond of the city - and its near-constant festivals. A welcome respite after a tenday of hunting.

541.speaker: Player
541.text: It's a fine thing - to be in a new place where I've never shed a drop of blood.

487.speaker: Gale
487.text: Not a sentiment I can entirely relate to, but a fresh start is always good for the spirit.

512.speaker: Player
512.text: Given the parts of it I'm forced to frequent, I'm surprised I've come to like it as I have.

381.speaker: Player
381.text: I only wish I were able to share more of it with you. But I'm content to be wherever you are.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Even the City of Splendours has its rough edges. I've enjoyed testing myself against them...

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: I confess, when I left Waterdeep there was a part of me afraid that I might regret my decision. But I never have.

391.speaker: Gale
391.text: I know our time together is rather snatched, but I assure you - it's also savoured. You remain very precious to me, as does everyone.
391.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but knows Shadowheart prefers to keep the commitment light between them

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: The chance to see life through your good eye, as well as my own - it's been everything I hoped it would be.

312.speaker: Gale
312.text: I'm delighted to be here amongst friends again, but part of me is reluctant to step away from our new life - even for such a gathering as this.

472.speaker: Player
472.text: I'm glad you've taken to life in Baldur's Gate so quickly. I thought you'd never leave Waterdeep...

200.speaker: Gale
200.text: I merely lacked the correct motivation, but even the City of Splendours itself fails to dazzle when set against your beauty.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: I'm just glad of a night off from the ever-present threat of danger and death.

178.speaker: Gale
178.text: Come now - our adventures have offered far more than the potential for destruction. I have enough looted literature to fill a dozen libraries.

300.speaker: Player
300.text: Don't worry - your books and my hearth will still be waiting for us when we get home.
300.context: NodeContext: Excited to clarify that he's a changed man

303.speaker: Gale
303.text: 'Home.' How I love to share that word with you.

444.speaker: Player
444.text: You don't have to be here if you don't want to, Gale...
444.context: NodeContext: Excited to clarify that he's a changed man

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: Oh, ignore me - I'm perfectly content. Besides, the chance to step out for a night on your arm is hardly one I'm going to pass up.
13.context: NodeContext: Excited to clarify that he's a changed man

453.speaker: Tara the Tressym
453.text: I'm just glad I'm not the only one encouraging you to leave the library once in a while. It does one good to feel the grass beneath one's paws from time to time.
453.context: NodeContext: Excited to clarify that he's a changed man

81.speaker: Gale
